alert.note: Alert for Harrison (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 6:29PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Harrison County through 645 PM EDT... At 629 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Williamstown, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Harrison County, including the following locations... Robinson, Colemansville, Oddville, Breckinridge, Renaker, Berry, Claysville, Garnett, Kelat and Venus. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
